newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine Sept-March raw sugar output up 10.9 pct.
newsitem.headline: Philippine Sept-March raw sugar output up 10.9 pct.

text.p: Philippine raw sugar output from September 1 to March 15 increased by 10.9 percent to 1.309 million tonnes from 1.18 million in the same period in the previous crop year, the Sugar Regulatory Administration said on Wednesday.
The crop year runs from September to August.
"The rise in production can be attributed to better weather conditions, increasing rate recovery on the cane," an SRA official told Reuters in an interview.
The official also said raw sugar prices at the farms between March 10 and 16 this year were pegged at an average 606 pesos per 50-kg bag as against the 520 price at the start of the year.
